sect4.title: Overview

entry.para: A 3D LUT is a tridimensional table which allows to transform any RGB value into another RGB value, normaly used for film simulation and color grading.
The module accepts .cube and .png (haldclut) files. The 3D LUT data are not saved in database nor in the XMP file, but just the path inside the 3D LUT folder (see below).

sect4.para: The module lut3d needs to find the 3D LUT file at the same place in your 3D LUT folder to calculate the output image. This means you have to backup properly your 3D LUT folder. Sharing an image with its XMP is useless if the recipient has not the same 3D LUT file in his 3D LUT folder.

sect5.title: file selection
sect5.para: File selection is inactive as long as the 3D LUT folder (where you have stored your LUT files) is not defined in 3D LUT root folder under preferences/core options/miscellaneous.

sect5.title: application color space
sect5.para: A 3D LUT is relative to a specific color space. You have to select the one for which it has been built. Cube files are usually related to REC.709 while most of others are related to sRGB.

sect5.title: interpolation
sect5.para: The interpolation method defines the way to calculate colors which are not exactly on a node of the RGB cube (described by the 3D LUT). There are three interpolation methods available: tetrahedral (the default one), trilinear and pyramid. Usually you don't see the difference between the interpolation methods except with small size LUTs.
